value.name: Search warrant near Winters reveals over a quarter pound of methamphetamines
value.description: Two men were arrested after a search warrant was executed in a rural property near Winters. The search warrant revealed about 131 grams of methamphetamine, or about a quarter of a pound, and an all terrain vehicle that was reported stolen out of Colusa,

value.name: Police search for Thomas Johnson, known to frequent Echuca
value.description: POLICE have called for help to locate wanted man Thomas Johnson. Johnson, 28, is wanted on warrant after he failed to appear at court in relation to traffic offences. He is known to frequent the Echuca and Shepparton areas.

value.name: Parole reform proposals call for expanding eligibility to higher level offenders in New York
value.description: Two bills currently proposed in the New York State Senate would change the protocol surrounding parole eligibility and release.

video.name: Parole reform proposals call for expanding eligibility to violent offenders in New York

value.name: Winters-area drug bust yields two arrests
value.description: Davis police reported seizing 131 grams of methamphetamine and a stolen ATV during the search of a Winters-area home Wednesday. Courtesy photo Davis police arrested two Winters men on Wednesday suspected of trafficking methamphetamine into the city of Davis. Acting on a tip received in March, detectives from the Davis Police Department’s Community Oriented Policing and Problem Solving Unit (COPPS) and the Yolo and Solano County sheriff’s offices served a search warrant at a rural property on Campos Lane outside the city of Winters, police said in a social media post. During the search, detectives seized 131 grams of methamphetamine and an all-terrain vehicle reported stolen out of Colusa, police said. (ATV) out of Colusa. David Martin, 61; and Thomas Johnson, 58; were booked into the Solano County Jail on charges of vehicle theft and possession of controlled substances with the intent to distribute. “Narcotics-related activities are directly tied to quality of life issues and criminal activity within the city of Davis and surrounding areas,” police said. “This warrant was issued pursuant to a lengthy investigation aimed at curbing narcotics trafficking and addressing community complaints related to a Davis apartment complex.”

value.name: J. Thomas Johnson Retires From First Community Corporation Board
value.description: First Community Corporation, the holding company of First Community Bank, revealed that J. Thomas "Tommy" Johnson will retire from the company's board of directors on May 19, 2021, after 17 years of service.

value.name: Race and policing in Delaware: Why are departments still mostly white, and what's at stake?
value.description: In large and small departments alike, most of Delaware’s police forces do not come close to resembling the residents they serve.
